etymologies: mid 19th century. From Hawaiian punalua the spouse of a sibling, person with whom one shares a spouse

definitions: A form of group marriage in which a wife's sisters and a husband's brothers are also considered to be spouses.

notes.text: Used by L. H. Morgan in his theory of the evolution of kinship systems, in which punalua was assumed to succeed promiscuity and precede exogamy.
